intro: Tarenna rhypalostigma, commonly known as the Madagascar star anise, is a climbing shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are small, capsule-like structures that contain aromatic seeds. Due to its unique appearance and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and herbalists alike.
